Class ManagementCompany

  • java.lang.Object
    • ManagementCompany

  • public class ManagementCompany
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a Management Company and its properties. Specifically, it stores owner, name, city, and rent information about no more than five properties for a Management Company in an array. The class provides methods for getting the total rent, maximum rent, and the index of the property with maximum rent. It also provides methods for returning a property given an index, returning a property owner name, returning a plot, returning a string with the information of properties. And, most importantly, it provides methods for adding properties to the property array.
    Author:
    hudson

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ManagementCompany()
      The constructor is a no-argument constructor that does not accept any parameters and creates a Management Company object using the fields/attributes of this class, including the plot field from which it creates a plot object.
      ManagementCompany(ManagementCompany otherCompany)
      This copy constructor creates a copy of a Management Company object by accepting another Management Company object as a parameter and creates a new Property array object.
      ManagementCompany(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String taxId, double mgmFeePer)
      This constructor creates a Management Company object and accepts a name, taxId, and mgmFeePer parameter.
      ManagementCompany(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String taxId, double mgmFeePer, int x, int y, int width, int depth)
      This constructor creates a Management Company object and accepts a name, taxId, mgmFeePer, x, y, width, and depth parameter.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int addProperty(Property property)
      This method adds a property to the property array and returns an integer value of -1 if the array is full, a value of -2 if the property is null, a value of -3 if the property is not encompassed by the Management Company plot, a value of -4 if any of the property plots overlap one another, or a value from 1 to 4 corresponding to the index of the property array in which the property is added.
      int addProperty(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String city, double rent, java.lang.String owner)
      This method adds a property to the property array and returns an integer value of -1 if the array is full, a value of -2 if the property is null, a value of -3 if the property is not encompassed by the Management Company plot, a value of -4 if any of the property plots overlap one another, or a value from 1 to 4 corresponding to the index of the property array in which the property is added.
      int addProperty(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String city, double rent, java.lang.String owner, int x, int y, int width, int depth)
      This method adds a property to the property array and returns an integer value of -1 if the array is full, a value of -2 if the property is null, a value of -3 if the property is not encompassed by the Management Company plot, a value of -4 if any of the property plots overlap one another, or a value from 1 to 4 corresponding to the index of the property array in which the property is added.
      java.lang.String displayPropertyAtIndex(int i)
      This method displays the property information for a property at a given index, i, which is accepted as a parameter.
      int getMAX_PROPERTY()
      This method returns the maximum number of properties for the property array and accepts no parameters.
      java.lang.String getName()
      This method returns the name of the Management Company and accepts no parameters.
      Plot getPlot()
      This method returns the Management Company plot and accepts no parameters.
      double maxRentProp()
      This method finds the property with the highest rent among the properties in the properties array.
      int maxRentPropertyIndex()
      This method determines the index of the property with the highest rent among the properties in the properties array.
      java.lang.String toString()
      This method returns the information of every property in the properties array as a string and accepts no parameters.
      double totalRent()
      This method determines the total rent amount of all the properties in the properties array.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ManagementCompany

        public ManagementCompany()
        The constructor is a no-argument constructor that does not accept any parameters and creates a Management Company object using the fields/attributes of this class, including the plot field from which it creates a plot object. It also creates a new Property array object.

      • ManagementCompany

        public ManagementCompany(java.lang.String name,
                         java.lang.String taxId,
                         double mgmFeePer)
        This constructor creates a Management Company object and accepts a name, taxId, and mgmFeePer parameter. It sets the fields of this class to these parameters and also creates a plot object. It also creates a new Property array object.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the Management Company
        taxId - The tax ID of the Management Company
        mgmFeePer - The management fee for the Management Company

      • ManagementCompany

        public ManagementCompany(java.lang.String name,
                         java.lang.String taxId,
                         double mgmFeePer,
                         int x,
                         int y,
                         int width,
                         int depth)
        This constructor creates a Management Company object and accepts a name, taxId, mgmFeePer, x, y, width, and depth parameter. It sets the fields of this class to these parameters. It also creates a new Property array object.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the Management Company
        taxId - The tax ID of the Management Company
        mgmFeePer - The management fee of the Management Company
        x - The x coordinate of the Management Company plot
        y - The y coordinate of the Management Company plot
        width - The width of the Management Company plot
        depth - The depth of the Management Company plot

      • ManagementCompany

        public ManagementCompany(ManagementCompany otherCompany)
        This copy constructor creates a copy of a Management Company object by accepting another Management Company object as a parameter and creates a new Property array object.
        Parameters:
        otherCompany - The Management Company object to be copied.

    • Method Detail

      • addProperty

        public int addProperty(Property property)
        This method adds a property to the property array and returns an integer value of -1 if the array is full, a value of -2 if the property is null, a value of -3 if the property is not encompassed by the Management Company plot, a value of -4 if any of the property plots overlap one another, or a value from 1 to 4 corresponding to the index of the property array in which the property is added. This method accepts a property object as a parameter.
        Parameters:
        property - The property object to be added to the properties array.
        Returns:
        The integer value corresponding either to the index of the array in which the property was added or one of the 4 scenarios.

      • addProperty

        public int addProperty(java.lang.String name,
                       java.lang.String city,
                       double rent,
                       java.lang.String owner)
        This method adds a property to the property array and returns an integer value of -1 if the array is full, a value of -2 if the property is null, a value of -3 if the property is not encompassed by the Management Company plot, a value of -4 if any of the property plots overlap one another, or a value from 1 to 4 corresponding to the index of the property array in which the property is added. This method accepts the name, city, rent, and owner of the property to be added to the properties array as its parameters.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the property.
        city - The city in which the property is located.
        rent - The rent amount for the property.
        owner - The owner of the property.
        Returns:
        The integer value corresponding either to the index of the array in which the property was added or one of the 4 scenarios.

      • addProperty

        public int addProperty(java.lang.String name,
                       java.lang.String city,
                       double rent,
                       java.lang.String owner,
                       int x,
                       int y,
                       int width,
                       int depth)
        This method adds a property to the property array and returns an integer value of -1 if the array is full, a value of -2 if the property is null, a value of -3 if the property is not encompassed by the Management Company plot, a value of -4 if any of the property plots overlap one another, or a value from 1 to 4 corresponding to the index of the property array in which the property is added. This method accepts the name, city, rent, owner, and plot fields of the property to be added to the properties array as its parameters.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the property owner.
        city - The city in which the property is located.
        rent - The rent amount for the property.
        owner - The owner of the property.
        x - The x-coordinate of the property.
        y - The y-coordinate of the property.
        width - The width of the property.
        depth - The depth of the property.
        Returns:
        The integer value corresponding either to the index of the array in which the property was added or one of the 4 scenarios.

      • displayPropertyAtIndex

        public java.lang.String displayPropertyAtIndex(int i)
        This method displays the property information for a property at a given index, i, which is accepted as a parameter.
        Parameters:
        i - The index of the property to be returned.
        Returns:
        The information of the property (i.e. owner, name, rent) at the index i.

      • getMAX_PROPERTY

        public int getMAX_PROPERTY()
        This method returns the maximum number of properties for the property array and accepts no parameters.
        Returns:
        The maximum amount of properties allowed in the properties array.

      • maxRentProp

        public double maxRentProp()
        This method finds the property with the highest rent among the properties in the properties array.
        Returns:
        The property with the highest rent.

      • maxRentPropertyIndex

        public int maxRentPropertyIndex()
        This method determines the index of the property with the highest rent among the properties in the properties array.
        Returns:
        The index corresponding to the property with the highest rent among the properties in the properties array.

      • totalRent

        public double totalRent()
        This method determines the total rent amount of all the properties in the properties array.
        Returns:
        The total rent amount of all the properties in the properties array.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
